guiSET.core

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.TextBased
        • guiSET.core.Container
          • guiSET.core.Frame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants

    public class Frame
extends Container
    Master Container that fills out entire sketch and controls the flow of events and rendering of the GUI.

    • Field Detail

      • DRAW_PRE

        public static final Frame.DrawTime DRAW_PRE
        GUI Draw time Mode: Draw the GUI before the PApplet.draw() happens. Useful when the user wants to image some own stuff upon the GUI. The draw time mode needs to be specified at the beginning when Frame is created. This is the default mode.

      • DRAW_POST

        public static final Frame.DrawTime DRAW_POST
        GUI Draw time Mode: Draw the GUI after the PApplet.draw() happens.The draw time mode needs to be specified at the beginning when Frame is created. Everything that is drawn during PApplet.draw() will be overwritten without ever being visible, except when Frame is transparent.

      • CONTINOUS

        public static final Frame.DrawMode CONTINOUS
        Draw frequency mode. Continous makes Frame draw the entire GUI EACH time (standard is 60 times per sec) if it has changed or not. This is useful if guiSET is combined with manual drawing on the sketch but it is the most wasteful mode.This is the default and for many cases recommended mode.

      • EFFICIENT

        public static final Frame.DrawMode EFFICIENT
        Draw frequency mode. Only refresh if an element has changed. It still keeps the PApplet.draw() loop running to check for some events but only redraws if necessary.

      • NO_LOOP

        public static final Frame.DrawMode NO_LOOP
        Most efficient mode. The PApplet.draw() loop is interrupted and only key and mouse events are still received and can change the state of the GUI. Animation timing is not as good.

      • DROP_STRING

        public static final int DROP_STRING
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DROP_FILE

        public static final int DROP_FILE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

                                java.lang.String methodName)
        Register a shortcut to the sketch and fire the given method when the combination is hit on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.

      • registerShortcut

        public boolean registerShortcut(Shortcut shortcut,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target)
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        target - object that declares the callback method.
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.
        See Also:
        version with custom target object.

      • registerShortcut

        public boolean registerShortcut(Shortcut shortcut,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target,
                                boolean strong)
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        target - object that declares the callback method.
        strong - Should this shortcut even work when a textbox has focus?
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.
        See Also:
        If strong is set to true then this shortcut will even work when a textbox has focus! Default is false.

      • deregisterShortcut

        public boolean deregisterShortcut(Shortcut shortcut)
        If the shortcut has been removed returns true. This is not the case if given shortcut has never been registered. The given shortcut does not need to be THE exact same as the registered one. It can be a new one with the same attributes.
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to deregister
        Returns:
        true if deregistering has been successful.

      • addAutoAnchors

        public void addAutoAnchors(int... anchors)
        Description copied from class: Control
        Add an anchor (types are TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT). Anchors ensure the element stays at fixed relative positions when the parent is resized. If opposite anchors are set, the element will be resized as well. When this function is called, the element will remember the CURRENT(!) distances to the parents bounds. Multiple anchors can be set with this method. This currently only works with Control.PIXEL_MODE and not with Control.PERCENTAGE_MODE. It is not possible to use this method if this element has not been added to a parent.
        Overrides:
        addAutoAnchors in class Control
        Parameters:
        anchors - accepts TOP, RIGHT, LEFT or BOTTOM. Pass up to four anchor types (order doesn't matter)

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(int anchorType,
                      int value)
        Description copied from class: Control
        Set an Anchor of type TOP BOTTOM, LEFT or RIGHT to a certain value. This also immediately sets the position or size of this element if necessary according to the anchors. It is not possible to use this method if this element has not been added to a parent. This version sets the anchor without changing its type like Control.setPercentageAnchor(int, int) and Control.setPixelAnchor(int, int).
        Overrides:
        setAnchor in class Control
        Parameters:
        anchorType - anchor direction
        value - value

      • addExternalDropListener

        public void addExternalDropListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                                    java.lang.Object target)
        External drop listener for data dropped to the application. Event arguments:
        1. int that describes data type (DROP_STRING or DROP_FILE)
        2. Object instance that is the dropped data (needs casting to String or File)
        3. Control instance - the element that the data has been dropped on
        Parameters:
        methodName - method name
        target - object
